fullText:
This year’s ceremony will be held in Washington, DC, on December 4.

The Kennedy Center has announced its 45th class of honorees, who will be celebrated for their lifetime artistic achievements.

This year's Kennedy Center Honors recipients are acclaimed actor and filmmaker George Clooney; contemporary Christian and pop singer-songwriter Amy Grant; legendary soul, Gospel, R&B, and pop singer Gladys Knight; Cuban-born American composer, conductor, and educator Tania León; and iconic Irish rock band U2, composed of band members Bono, The Edge, Adam Clayton, and Larry Mullen Jr.

The ceremony will be held on December 4 at the Kennedy Center in Washington, DC, and will be broadcast on CBS at a later date. Done Dusted, the award-winning production company and producers of the Center's Mark Twain Prize since 2018, have been selected as executive producers of the 45th annual Kennedy Center Honors.

For more information about the honorees, click here.

Broadway performances start on March 27 at the Majestic Theatre.
dtliExcerpt: The new Broadway revival of Spamalot at the St. James Theatre is a joyous, silly, and thoroughly entertaining production that captures the anarchic spirit of Monty Python while updating the material for contemporary audiences.
showScoreExcerpt: The new Broadway revival of Spamalot at the St. James Theatre is a joyous, silly, and thoroughly entertaining production that captures the anarchic spirit of Monty Python while updating the material for contemporary audiences.

llmScore.reasoning: [ensemble-unanimous] | All 3 models agree: Positive | Claude: The critic uses multiple positive descriptors (joyous, thoroughly entertaining) and notes it successfully captures the source material's spirit while updating appropriately, indicating a clear recommendation. | GPT-4o: The review describes the production as 'joyous' and 'thoroughly entertaining,' indicating a strong recommendation to see the show. | Gemini: The review uses positive language like "joyous," "silly," and "thoroughly entertaining," indicating a positive recommendation.
